body: Added unit tests and implemented within.

sorry for this...

intended to pull to my master instead of apache:master
Throwing in a comment on a random PR to make sure the project gets it on their ML. Apologies.

Updated patch
- Clean up and unify various shell scripts.

I've been working on SqlLine under both native windows and cygwin recently. Consider bringing some of those fixes in. See recent commits to optiq-csv. https://github.com/julianhyde/optiq-csv/commits/master

The PR looks good!
Btw I think Travis is dieing on org.apache.drill.exec.physical.impl.TestHashToRandomExchange, where it seems to timeout. Does this test timeout on your machine Steven? I wonder where we can tune this too.

Updated patch to use SwappedByteBuf to have the same endianness for the buffers used in workspace variables and buffers in the ValueVectors.
Enabled the tests for Decimal.
Updated patch to add support for date literals from SQL. Literals for Date, Time, TimeStamp, IntervalDay, IntervalYear are supported.
Addressed few review comments in the updated patch.

Updated pull request with the following changes.
Rebased to latest master.
Added support for SQL integration for decimal data type.

One high-level comment regarding the code organization:  normally,  we recommend keeping the operator's internal control flow and logic in the template class (in this case HashJoinTemplate) and only put the stuff that code generator needs in the 'batch' class.  Perhaps we should discuss this ?

Moved the logic that invokes run time generated code into the template so it has a better chance of getting optimized. 

Addressed the other minor comments as well.

Merged into drill/master as f8f12df99399fb0097ac4c1388d5ccce9a36d48d, 05710a66e0249e34442de1cdc684334281842563.

DRILL-484 will be fixed as part of DRILL-494.

Updated pull request. Now the operator is parsed in Parser rather then in Lexer.
Patch re-based on latest master branch.
rebased on latest master and fixed an issue in earlier fix.
please close, i believe this is merged.
please close, this has been merged.

Hey Ajay,

Thanks for the patch but we have these math functions implemented. We use freemarker template to generate these functions for all the data types. Here is a spread sheet with functions that haven't been implemented yet : https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=0AgAGbQ6asvQ-dDRrUUxVSVlMVXRtanRoWk9JcHgteUE&usp=drive_web#gid=0
It would be great if you can get some of these implemented.

Thanks for the link. I'd seen the template already, but I didn't know if that and the implementations in Java were separate. I'll get to work on the functions in the spreadsheet. If I'm not wrong, the trigo functions have been implemented and need to be committed (DRILL-219)
Yes we have a pending patch for Trignometric functions. It would be good if you can create a JIRA for the set of functions you are working on to avoid duplicating effort.
Closing the pull request, will track on JIRA.
Closing the pull request, will track on JIRA.

Thanks for the pull request! As the project is run under the apache foundation we only use github as mirror for the work done over on the apache repo. Would you mind creating a bug report on our tracker and uploading a patch to the bug report?

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/DRILL
@hsuanyi please close this pull request, it has been fixed, and I can't close it.
@jinfengni please close this pull request, I fixed the doc, but can't close this pull request.

Fixed, and published. @abengelbrecht please close this pull request (I can't do it).

Do we want to stick with .info() for these messages instead of .debug()? Asking because I'm not sure, but it seems like noise.

Otherwise, non-binding "ship it."
DRILL-2815, DRILL-3496 Adding a link to the related JIRA reports

It seems we will be logging too much at DEBUG level (mainly through LogicalOperatorBase and PhysicalOperatorUtil); it will clutter Lilith specially. 

IMO,
1) Overrides in DrillConfig (step 3 and 4 in DrillConfig#create) could be at INFO level.
2) Drillbit logs could be as they are.
3) Every other log statement in your patch should be TRACE level.

What do you think?

> ... clutter Lilith ... 3) Every other log statement in your patch should be TRACE level. ...

Commit 872309a... reverts to one log call and log entry per list, but retains the improved readability by putting each listed item on a separate line.

> ... 1) Overrides in DrillConfig (step 3 and 4 in DrillConfig#create) could be at INFO level. ...

Since the set of per-module configuration files is affected by user action (installing plug-ins), step 2's logging should probably be at the same level. 

And then, since that's reporting every configuration file except the defaults file, maybe the defaults file should also be listed at the same level.

Comments?  (INFO for all those config files?)
Since "user action" affects the messages, I'd say INFO.
+1 on the second change, I'm going to squash these into a single commit before I merge them.
In 4e9a2a1 commit message, you mentioned that you added "final". There are quite a few places where you have not added "final". Please fix?

Apologies for the forthcoming double comments. I forgot to make comments on the pull request and instead was viewing the individual commit. These comments are nicely aggregated on the github IU, but are not currently picked up the the JIRA bot to copy the comments to the issue report. I will be duplicating my comments on the same lines they were on the individual commit on the pull request summary diff to make sure they get copied over.

> Would be good to note here the purpose. ...

Done.

It seems that you have shaded references to every Java package other than org.apache.drill.*\* (not just for every package from every depended-on artifact, but for _every_ package--including JDK packages).

Note how the following command says it can't find "oadd/java/sql/Driver":

$ java -cp ./exec/jdbc-all/target/drill-jdbc-all-1.2.0-SNAPSHOT.jar org.apache.drill.jdbc.Driver
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: oadd/java/sql/Driver
...

It seems that in trying to load org.apache.drill.jdbc.Driver it tried to load its base class, normally java.sql.Driver from the JDK, but the reference to that base class was shaded to oadd.org.java.sql.Driver, so of course it couldn't be found.

(The expected behavior of that command is an error that org.apache.drill.jdbc.Driver doesn't have a main method.)

What setup did you use to test the shading?
addressed the comment left by @amansinha100 by adding a comment to ExternalSortBatch.cleanupBatchGroups()
